General.name: Kinematics

Frames of reference (inertial vs non-inertial, qualitative)

General.name: Laws of Motion

Applications (incl. pulley systems, inclined plane, connected bodies)
Conservation of linear momentum (1D and 2D collisions)
Center of mass and motion of center of mass

General.name: Work, Energy and Power
topics: Work done by constant and variable forces
Energy in collisions and circular motion (qualitative and quantitative)

topics: Relation between linear and angular quantities
Moment of inertia (calculation for common bodies)
Parallel axis and perpendicular axis theorems
Rolling without slipping, energy of rolling bodies

General.name: Gravitation
topics: Acceleration due to gravity and its variation with altitude and depth

General.name: Properties of Solids and Liquids
topics: Elastic behavior: stress, strain, Hooke's law
Young's modulus, bulk modulus, shear modulus
Pressure in a fluid, Pascal's law
Surface tension, capillarity, drop and bubble phenomena

topics: Simple harmonic motion (SHM): time period, frequency, amplitude
Wave motion: transverse and longitudinal waves
Standing waves on strings and in pipes

Equipotential surfaces, potential energy of charge systems
Capacitance, parallel plate capacitor, capacitors in series and parallel

Force on a moving charge and on a current-carrying conductor (Lorentz force)
Moving coil galvanometer and conversion to ammeter/voltmeter
Electromagnetic induction: Faraday's law and Lenz's law
Self and mutual inductance, LR circuits

Solution of linear systems: Cramer's rule, matrix method

Algebra.name: Permutations and Combinations

Algebra.name: Binomial Theorem

Middle term and properties of binomial coefficients

Algebra.name: Sequence & Series

Algebra.name: Limits, Continuity and Differentiability

Chain rule, product and quotient rules
Higher order derivatives (up to second order)
Applications: tangents, normals, maxima and minima

Algebra.name: Integral Calculus

Applications: area under curve, area between curves

Algebra.name: Differential Equations

Linear first order ODEs and simple higher order ODEs (basic)

Algebra.name: Coordinate Geometry
topics: Straight lines: various forms, slope, intercepts, distance from point to line
Conic sections: parabola, ellipse, hyperbola – standard forms and properties
Pair of straight lines, locus problems
3D geometry: coordinates in space, distance between points, direction cosines/ratios, equation of lines and planes, angle/shortest distance between skew lines

Algebra.name: Vector Algebra
topics: Vector equations of lines and planes (basic use)

Algebra.name: Statistics and Probability

Physical.name: Chemical Thermodynamics

Second law of thermodynamics: entropy and spontaneity

Physical.name: Chemical and Ionic Equilibrium
topics: Common ion effect and solubility product

Physical.name: Chemical Kinetics

Temperature dependence of rate constant (Arrhenius equation)

Van't Hoff factor and its effect

Physical.name: Surface Chemistry

Crystal lattices and unit cells (SC, BCC, FCC, HCP)
Ionic radii and radius ratio rules

Inorganic.name: Classification and Periodicity
topics: Modern periodic law and long-form periodic table
Periodic trends: atomic/ionic radii, ionization enthalpy, electron affinity, electronegativity

Inorganic.name: Hydrogen
topics: Position of hydrogen in periodic table and isotopes
Properties of water and heavy water

Inorganic.name: s-Block Elements

Anomalous behavior of Li and Be
Important compounds: oxides, hydroxides, carbonates, halides, nitrates

Inorganic.name: d-Block Elements (Transition Metals)
topics: General electronic configuration and characteristic properties
Variable oxidation states, color of compounds, catalytic behavior
Important reagents and compounds (e.g., KMnO4, K2Cr2O7)

Inorganic.name: f-Block Elements
topics: Basic chemistry of lanthanoids and actinoids (qualitative)

Inorganic.name: Coordination Compounds
topics: Basic bonding ideas: valence bond and qualitative crystal field concepts
Spectrochemical series and magnetic properties (spin concepts)

Inorganic.name: Metallurgy and Isolation of Metals
topics: Principles of extraction of metals from concentrated ores (thermodynamic and electrolytic processes)
Refining methods and metallurgy of common metals (Fe, Cu, Al)
Important processes: cyanide process for gold and silver (qualitative)

Inorganic.name: Qualitative Inorganic Analysis

Common anions: CO3(2-), SO4(2-), NO3(-), Cl(-), Br(-), I(-), S(2-) and their tests (qualitative)

Inorganic.name: Environmental Chemistry
topics: Air pollution: major pollutants and their effects (CO, CO2, NOx, SOx, particulate matter)

Organic.name: Basic Principles of Organic Chemistry

Reaction types: substitution, addition, elimination, rearrangement, radical reactions

Organic.name: Hydrocarbons

Alkenes: structure, geometry, electrophilic addition reactions, Markovnikov rule, anti-Markovnikov (peroxide effect), polymerization, ozonolysis

Aromatic hydrocarbons: benzene structure and aromaticity, electrophilic aromatic substitution (nitration, halogenation, Friedel–Crafts reactions), directing effects of substituents

Organic.name: Organic Compounds Containing Halogens
topics: Alkyl and aryl halides: nomenclature and bonding
Nucleophilic substitution reactions: SN1 and SN2 mechanisms
Reactivity differences between alkyl and aryl halides

Organic.name: Organic Compounds Containing Oxygen
topics: Alcohols: classification (1°, 2°, 3°), preparation, reactions (dehydration, oxidation, substitution), acidic character
Phenols: acidity, electrophilic substitution reactions, Reimer–Tiemann and Kolbe reactions

Carboxylic Acids and Derivatives: acidity, preparation, conversions to esters, acid chlorides, amides

Organic.name: Organic Compounds Containing Nitrogen
topics: Amines: classification, basicity, methods of preparation (Gabriel synth., Hoffmann degradation), reactions and diazotization
Diazonium salts: formation and synthetic applications (Sandmeyer, coupling reactions)
Important nitrogen containing functional groups and reactivity

Organic.name: Purification and Characterization
topics: Purification techniques: crystallization, distillation, sublimation, extraction, chromatography (principles)
Determination of empirical and molecular formula (conceptual)

Organic.name: Biomolecules, Polymers and Practical Organic Chemistry
topics: Carbohydrates: classification, structure of glucose and fructose, glycosidic bonds
Amino acids and proteins: peptide bond and primary structure (qualitative), denaturation
Nucleic acids: basic structure of DNA and RNA (qualitative)
Polymers: addition and condensation polymerization, examples (polyethylene, nylon, Teflon, PVC, biodegradable polymers)
Soaps and detergents: structure and cleansing action
Practical tests for functional groups and simple titrations (qualitative understanding)
